sentence.Network_en: Her main fault was a brooding, eternal immitigable suspicion of all men, things, creeds and parties.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的主要错误是对一切人 、 事 、 信条与党派都抱郁郁沉思 、 一成不变、不能缓和的怀疑态度.

PerfectNetExp.abs: immit 注入immitigable 不能缓和的immix 混合
v. 镇静,缓和,减轻;v. 缓和 mitigate a. 不能放宽的,不能缓和的,不能减轻的 immitigable a. 缓和的,减轻的,掩饰的;n. 辩解,可斟酌 palliative.
不能防御地indefensibly不能放宽的immitigable不能飞的flightless

list.abs: 难以平息的暴怒 immitigable wrath  墨守成规 immobilism  暴饮暴食 immoderate eating and drinking  旧时宰杀活人祭雷神 Human victims wre immolated to the.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from late Latin immitigabilis, from in- 'not' + mitigabilis 'able to be mitigated'
